Comments_List:
This course is an excellent introduction into the field of soft matter.  Specific focus areas include rheological techniques, basic fluid and thermal dynamics, Van der Waal forces, and colloidal suspensions.  

Most importantly, this course has an overarching focus on the nature of research itself.

lots of knowledge about soft matter, which is really useful.

I also learned some coding skills and knowledge.
Mechanical properties of soft matter, rheology, computational simulation of soft matters.

This course is presented in a logical and easily understood manner such that even the most novice soft-matter student can understand.  There is a tremendous amount of student interaction and lots of interesting examples to real world physical systems.  The capstone projects also provided an outstanding mechanism for combining all the skills learned throughout the course.

The only negative is that with all the discussion and student interaction, the course regularly runs overtime.
Strengths - Informal discussions, interesting topics, not too much work.
Absolutely yes.  Not only does this course provide an excellent introduction into the field, but it's just plain fun.  The collegiate atmosphere is what I had hoped for at yale.
Yes. The instructor is really nice. Office hour is really helpful.
I'd recommend this course because it's very interesting and engaging.
